TopicTitle: Munation - Constellation Replica with Ares V, Ares I, Orion and Altair

Articles.Content:
So let's make replicas of the Constellation Program!

First of all:

-Ares V

-Altair

-Orion MPCV

-Ares I

Have your Ares I Here!

Ares V isn't ready to upload yet

And now, some impressions:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Have fun!!

Edited December 4, 2013 by Nephf
That's amazing! What is the part count on this beast?

Great job on these! Assuming the Ares V and Altair lander will follow the Ares I, do you have any plans for the Space Launch System (SLS), considering it is the current plan for the future of NASA exploration? Oh, and one thing: solar panels on the Orion MPCV? Not trying to bug you, magnificent job, far better than my garbage.

Edited November 26, 2013 by Woopert

Great job on these! Assuming the Ares V and Altair lander will follow the Ares I, do you have any plans for the Space Launch System (SLS), considering it is the current plan for the future of NASA exploration? Oh, and one thing: solar panels on the Orion MPCV? Not trying to bug you, magnificent job, far better than my garbage.

Come on, wait for Ares V until you come with SLS. But I have some problems with an accurate Altair replica. And the Orion has Solar Panels, I just didn't open them.

... and a constellation Mars Mission will also be before SLS

Edited November 26, 2013 by Nephf
Looks awesome, but the core stage should be longer

Looks awesome, but the core stage should be longer

I know, but then it gets heavier and heavier and heavier...

That's amazing! What is the part count on this beast?

250

Edited November 26, 2013 by Nephf

I know, but then it gets heavier and heavier and heavier...

Someone dealt with the TWR issue by clipping Skipper engines for the core stage. His looked really good too.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/55395-Ares-I-Delta-IV-Heavy-and-Orion-MPCV?highlight=Ares

Someone dealt with the TWR issue by clipping Skipper engines for the core stage. His looked really good too.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/55395-Ares-I-Delta-IV-Heavy-and-Orion-MPCV?highlight=Ares

The Ares I first stage is solid fueled, it's a space shuttle booster

The Ares I first stage is solid fueled, it's a space shuttle booster

I know the first stage is an SRB, but I was going more for an accurate appearance and performance. Unless bigger SRBs get added in the future, I think liquid fuel is the way to go.

I know the first stage is an SRB, but I was going more for an accurate appearance and performance. Unless bigger SRBs get added in the future, I think liquid fuel is the way to go.

I don't think so. Liquid Fuel is just wrong, and the diameter has to be bigger at the end of the rocket to place large engines.

Edit: who gave this thread a low Rating?

Edited November 28, 2013 by Nephf

I don't think so. Liquid Fuel is just wrong, and the diameter has to be bigger at the end of the rocket to place large engines.

I'm currently a bit busy to try your Ares I, but for how long does your core booster burn?

As long as a SRB burns normally, but with 12Ãƒâ€” the thrust.

Ares I Update 1.1:

-More Liftoff thrust

-Longer Core Stage

-Complete new LES

Ares I Update 1.2:

-thinner core stage

-core stage parachutes

-stage seperate engines

-new MPCV Service Module

Ares I Update 1.3:

-Complete Core Stage rebuild

-More SAS Force

-Removed structural problems between the stages

-more stage seperation engines
